metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: Mortgage  Susan S. Keith  to   Wm Henry Heyward  & James B. Heyward  Trustees. [End Page 1] THE STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA,  Richland District.  Personally appeared before me James B. Heyward Jr and made oath that he saw Mrs Susan S Keith Sign, Seal and Deliver the within Mortgage, for the uses and purposes therein mentioned; and that he with Miss Mary B. Heyward in the presence of each other, witnessed the due execution thereof. James B. Heyward Jr.  SWORN to before me, this the Eighty day of August 1863  D. T. McDonald  Magistrate [End Page 2] MORTGAGE FOR PERSONAL PROPERTY Printed by R. W. Gibbes.  The State of South Carolina: To all to whom these presents shall come, I, Susan S. Keith of Charleston in the State aforesaid, send GREETING: WHEREAS, I the said Susan S. Keith, in and by my Bond bearing even date with this presents, stand firmly held and bound unto Wm Henry Heyward and James B. Heyward Trustees in the penal sum of Two Thousand Dollars- with a condition thereunder written for the payment of the full and just sum of One Thousand Dollars as in and by the said Bond as aforesaid and condition thereof (Relation thereunto being had), doth more fully and at large appear. NOW KNOW YE, That I the said Susan S. Keith for the better securing the payment of the said sum above mentioned, unto the said Wm Henry Heyward and James B Heyward, Trustees, their Executors, Administrators or Assigns, together with lawful interest for the same, have bargained and sold, and by these presents do bargain and sell, and in plain and open market deliver unto the said Wm Henry Heyward and James B. Heyward Trustees a negro slave named John TO HAVE AND TO HOLD the said negro slave John unto the said Wm Henry Heyward and James B. Heyward Trustees, their Executors, Administrators and Assigns, forever: PROVIDED ALWAYS, NEVERTHELESS, That if the said Susan S. Keith her Executors and Administrators, shall and do well and truly pay, or cause to be paid, unto the said Wm Henry Heyward and James B. Heyward Trustees their certain Attorney, Executors, Administrators or Assigns, the full and just sum above mentioned, according to the true intent and meaning of the Bond as aforesaid, and of these presents, then this deed of bargain and sale, and all and every clause, article and thing therein contained, shall cease, determine, and be utterly void, and of none effect: any thing herein before contained to the contrary thereof in any wise notwithstanding. AND IT IS HEREBY DECLARED, by and between the parties, and the said Susan S. Keith for her Executors, Administrators and Assigns, doth covenant, promise and agree to and with the said Wm Henry Heyward & James B. Heyward, Trustees, their Executors, Administrators and Assigns, by these presents, that if default shall happen to be made of, or in payment of the said sum above mentioned, according to the true intent and meaning of the said Bond as aforesaid that then and in such case, it shall and may be lawful to and for the said Wm Henry Heyward & James B. Heyward their Executors, Administrators, Assigns, Attorneys or Agents, from time to time, and at any times hereafter, peaceably and quietly, to enter into any or all of the messuages, lands or tenements of the said Susan S. Keith and to take the said negro slave John into their custody and possession, and the same to hold and detain to their own use and behoof (as their own proper good and chattel) from thenceforth and forever, or the same to sell and dispose of at their will and pleasure; returning the overplus, if any should happen to be, after paying of the sum above mentioned, unto the said Susan S. Keith her Executors, Administrators or Assigns. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, I the said Susan S. Keith have hereunto set my Hand and Seal this Seventh day of August in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and sixty three and in the second year of the Sovereignty and Independence of the Confederate States of America. Susan S Keith.  Signed, Sealed and Delivered, in the presence of   James B. Heyward Jr.  Mary B. Heyward [End Page 3]
